stories.text:
From my experience most of the companies scouting for developers are trying to minimize costs and using the “fully remote” positions as a mean.

I almost never faced an HR ready to discuss salaries higher, than my current “above average” full-time salary in my region (~120-180k).

I wonder what should your CV look like and how should you approach the search for companies that can afford expensive developers no matter the geo.

If the goal is not worth the effort in the first place — what alternative scalable ways to increase senior programmer’s income can you recommend?

Scalable means more or less reproducible in finite timeframe without high risks like in “starting your own startup”.
stories.title: Ask HN: Strategies to land fully remote $250k+ job
We All Need to Stop Only Seeing the Dark Side of Crypto
Richard Rogers: Pompidou and Millennium Dome architect dies aged 88
Ohio Gov deploys National Guard to hospitals as Covid deaths surpass 2020 levels

stories.text:
Not necessary all of the technological goods are actually for the benefit of people: some of them do prove obsessive behavior in some of us.

Why this happens - only guessable: escalation of inside harm towards self which spreads through the whole life may be healable by choosing a different path which caused current situation.

It may be escalated due to tech, but most probably due to sticking to tech for too long, without producing meaningful results (however valuing the path).

I am sharing the video which resonated the thought, enlightening the harm.

https://youtu.be/6CKZpJb36hs
stories.title: ADHD and Technology: Dependency or Cause
